definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: Circle the phonemes in each word in a different colour pencil.
sentences.chinese: 用不同的顏色筆圈出每一個單詞的音素。

sentences.english: A computer must have the phoneme string, or pronunciation, for each word that it is expected to recognize.
sentences.chinese: 對於將被識別的詞，計算機必須有其音素流或發音。

sentences.english: The composer dialog has buttons for each of the phonemes for a language.
sentences.chinese: 對於一種語言的每個音素該組合框都有相應的按鈕。

sentences.english: The connections between letters and phonemes would appear simple enough.
sentences.chinese: 字母與音素之間的聯繫，看來很簡單。

sentences.english: Students will learn to discern the supra- segmental features listening to spoken English and enhance their listening.
sentences.chinese: 同學們將能分辨口語英語的超音段音素及加強聽力。

sentences.english: Chinese phoneme characters can break through the neatness of the phonetic annotation of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 漢語音素可以突破音素化漢字注音方案的整齊性。

sentences.english: Chinese phoneme characters can break through the neatness of the phonetic annotation of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 漢語音素可以突破音素化漢字注音方案的整齊性。

sentences.english: Phonological and phonemic awareness are closely associated with reading ability.
sentences.chinese: 音韻和音素意識和閱讀能力是緊密相連的。

definition: the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling/(phonics) blending
diphthong (such as putonghua ɑi, ei etc)
language component/morpheme/individual characters (making up an expression)
